version.description: Prints just the compiler's version and exits.

config.description: Configuration file to apply. CLI arguments take precedence.

target.description: Configuration file target to use. Defaults to 'release'.

description: Optimizes the module. Typical shorthands are:
Default optimizations   -O
Make a release build    -O --noAssert
Make a debug build      --debug
Optimize for speed      -Ospeed
Optimize for size       -Osize

optimizeLevel.description: How much to focus on optimizing code. [0-3]

shrinkLevel.description: How much to focus on shrinking code size. [0-2, s=1, z=2]

converge.description: Re-optimizes until no further improvements can be made.

noAssert.description: Replaces assertions with just their value without trapping.

textFile.description: Specifies the WebAssembly text output file (.wat).

description: Specifies the bindings to generate (.js + .d.ts).
esm  JavaScript bindings & typings for ESM integration.
raw  Like esm, but exports just the instantiate function.
Useful where modules are meant to be instantiated
multiple times or non-ESM imports must be provided.
Enables source map generation. Optionally takes the URL
used to reference the source map from the binary file.

debug.description: Enables debug information in emitted binaries.

noExportMemory.description: Does not export the memory as 'memory'.

initialMemory.description: Sets the initial memory size in pages.

maximumMemory.description: Sets the maximum memory size in pages.

sharedMemory.description: Declare memory as shared. Requires maximumMemory.

zeroFilledMemory.description: Assume imported memory is zeroed. Requires importMemory.

description: Exports the start function using the specified name instead
of calling it implicitly. Useful for WASI or to obtain the
exported memory before executing any code accessing it.
Specifies the runtime variant to include in the program.
incremental  TLSF + incremental GC (default)
minimal      TLSF + lightweight GC invoked externally
stub         Minimal runtime stub (never frees)
...          Path to a custom runtime implementation
Always exports the runtime helpers (__new, __collect, __pin etc.).
When host "bindings" is enabled it will be determined automatically.
Overrides the stack size. Only relevant for incremental GC
or when using a custom runtime that requires stack space.
Defaults to 0 without and to 16384 with incremental GC.
Enables WebAssembly features being disabled by default.
threads             Threading and atomic operations.
simd                SIMD types and operations.
reference-types     Reference types and operations.
gc                  Garbage collection (WIP).
Disables WebAssembly features being enabled by default.
mutable-globals     Mutable global imports and exports.
sign-extension      Sign-extension operations
nontrapping-f2i     Non-trapping float to integer ops.
bulk-memory         Bulk memory operations.
Aliases a global object under another name, e.g., to switch
the default 'Math' implementation used: --use Math=JSMath
Can also be used to introduce an integer constant.

memoryBase.description: Sets the start offset of emitted memory segments.

tableBase.description: Sets the start offset of emitted table elements.

transform.description: Specifies the path to a custom transform to load.

description: Sets the trap mode to use.
allow  Allow trapping operations. This is the default.
clamp  Replace trapping operations with clamping semantics.
js     Replace trapping operations with JS semantics.
Specifies additional Binaryen passes to run after other
optimizations, if any. See: Binaryen/src/passes/pass.cpp

noValidate.description: Skips validating the module using Binaryen.

baseDir.description: Specifies the base directory of input and output files.

description: Disallows the use of unsafe features in user code.
Does not affect library files and external modules.
Disables warnings matching the given diagnostic code.
If no diagnostic code is given, all warnings are disabled.

noEmit.description: Performs compilation as usual but does not emit code.

showConfig.description: Print computed compiler options and exit.

stats.description: Prints statistics on I/O and compile times.

pedantic.description: Make yourself sad for no good reason.

description: Adds one or multiple paths to custom library components and
uses exports of all top-level files at this path as globals.
Adds one or multiple paths to package resolution, similar
to node_modules. Prefers an 'ascMain' entry in a package's
package.json and falls back to an inner 'assembly/' folder.

wasm.description: Uses the specified Wasm binary of the compiler.

....description: Specifies node.js options (CLI only). See: node --help
